page.title: 01BURNESTON AND CARTHORPE
page.content: The land around Burneston and Carthorpe is quite flat, the fields are used for crops, mostly corn. The main road through Burneston is parallel with the A1 so we get some lorries passing. We would like a speed limit. In Burneston there is a primary school for 4 to 11 yearolds and there is a playground and playingfield. The playingfield used to be an orchard, and there was a sweet shop where the school now is. The old school near the Church is now used as a nursery school, and was built in 1852. In Burneston there was a chapel built in 1859, but it is not used now. Carthorpe does not have a Church, but the chapel is used. The old houses are of cobble or brick, with slate or pantile rooves.
